info.title: billwerk REST API
info.description:
This document describes the endpoints of the billwerk REST API. You can find out more about billwerk here.

This documentation offers interactive features which will enable you to test how our system behaves. To use the interactive features you have to aquire a bearer token for your active billwerk sandbox account. This procedure is described here. OAuth token URL for sandbox is https://sandbox.billwerk.com/oauth/token/, for production https://app.billwerk.com/oauth/token/. Please be aware the URL does not include [...]/api/v1/[...]After aquiring the token you must go through the 'Authorize'-Form down below (green button). You're now able to use the interactive features.
Please be aware your sandbox account will be affected trying out the endpoints!

This documentation is still work in progress!

Return to https://developer.billwerk.io/

post.summary: Creates a file download token for the given Accounting Export File.

parameters.description: Concatenate to URL to limit search to specific contract

parameters.name: from

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: If you are using pagination, you can skip n items (1000 max.)

post.summary: Execute interim billing for a specific contract

get.summary: Retrieves a cancellation preview for a contract
get.description:
Retrieves a cancellation preview for a contract for a regular cancellation, considering contract and notice periods of the booked PlanVariant.

Property EndDate describes the date at which the contract would be cancelled when doing a regular cancellation. Property NextPossibleCancellationDate describes the date until which the contract can be cancelled using a regular cancellation achieving the next possible end date of the contract while adhering to the contract and notice periods configured.

parameters.name: cancellationTime
parameters.description: Defines when the contract will be cancelled

get.summary: Retrieve a short-lived selfservice access token
get.description:
The token can be used by your customers to change their account and payment information for the given contract.
Retrieve the token immediately before redirecting the customer.

parameters.name: tokenValidity
parameters.description: Token validity, limited up to 10080 minutes (or 7 days)

delete.description: As long as the usage hasn't been billed yet, you can simply DELETE it. Otherwise, the process becomes ill-defined, especially in light of free quota. You can deduct the overbilled amount in the following month or write a credit note manually.

Retrieve the expected amount of the next billing / invoice

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: This parameter is optional. By default the request will return currently active subscriptions. When passing the timestamp parameter the response will contain active subscription at the specified time.

get.summary: Rest endpoint for direct download of invoice PDFs

post.summary: Creates a file download token for the given invoice.
post.description:
The file can subsequenlty be downloaded through the given URL.
Please note that that URL is not under /api/v1 and doesn't need an OAuth token, i.e. you can present these links to your users.
Consequently, the links have limited validity.

post.summary: Create a new plan/component subscription or up/downgrade order.
post.description:
Please note, orders might have a limited lifetime. For simple signup/subscription implementation we recommend using SubscriptionJS rather than API, unless you have strong reasons.

CustomerChange does NOT work on Signups. The JSON must resemble a CustomerDTO.

get.summary: Retrieve a single order

post.description: This is an feature discriminated endpoint. Make sure your account has this feature enabled or contact support.

Finalizing an initial signup order usually includes an interactive payment processed on client side by the customer. When using this API endpoint rather than SubscriptionJS no customer interaction is involved. For this reason the endpoint can only be used for payment on account or if no payment method is required. For interactive payment please use paySignupInteractive() from SubscriptionJS instead. Committing signup order without payment method must be activated in plan variant settings! When finalizing orders for an existing contract payment is done asynchronously from the order process with the currently active payment method. In contrast to upgradePaySync() in SubscriptionJS the order is finished successful independent from a successful payment. If you don't want this behaviour please use upgradePaySync() from SubscriptionJS. Committing an order might trigger a billing process. Potential credits from the old plan and receivables from the new plan will be applied to the ledger. An invoice will be created. If a plan up-/downgrade is involved the billing and fee periods will be based upon update time. If an order is scheduled for a future date the billing process might not be triggered with the commit. This depends on several conditions.

To use possibly existing payment data just commit an empty payload -> {}!

Allowed PaymentMethods are: "Debit:Paymill", "Debit:PayOne", "Debit:Wirecard", "Debit:Heidelpay", "Debit:SlimPay", "Debit:Stripe", "Debit:FakePSP", "OnAccount:PayOne", "BlackLabel:InvoicePayment", "None:None"
This is an feature discriminated endpoint. Make sure your account has this feature enabled or contact support.

post.summary: Previews an order with pricing information
post.description:
This endpoint works very similar to POST /Orders, by retuning an order object, but does not actually create the order persistently.
You can pass the same data. It can be used to show pricing information of the cart.
Likewise a real order creation it takes into account passed customer data like VAT ID and country to determine the actual price and taxes.
